ai-mil5.3.10:1.1_0: “When the Buddha spoke like this, he said,
ai-mil5.3.10:1.2_0: If others praise me, the Realized One, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and excited.
ai-mil5.3.10:3.1_0: And he told him about this.
ai-mil5.3.10:3.2_0: If others praise me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and excited.
ai-mil5.3.10:3.3_0: If anyone praises, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and excited, which would you not praise that practice.
ai-mil5.3.10:3.4_0: This is a bowl and robes that should be kept for you.”
ai-mil5.3.10:4.2_0: If others praise me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and excited.’
ai-mil5.3.10:4.3_0: And when anyone praises the brahmins, he experienced more high and low, cransmision,
ai-mil5.3.10:6.1_0: The Buddha has developed the direct knowledge of the teaching, a real, and accurate recollection of the teaching, it is true, and substantively.
ai-mil5.3.10:6.2_0: If others praise me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and excited.’
ai-mil5.3.10:6.3_0: While this praise of the Buddha, the Sakyans of is being spoken, more splendid and bountiful, saying,
ai-mil5.3.10:6.4_0: King Sela, I am the king of the teaching, not because of desire, ill will, confusion, or fear.
ai-mil5.3.10:6.5_0: ‘I am a king, a supreme Dhamma speaker.’”
ai-mil5.3.10:6.6_0: “It’s good, Sir, that you should repeat what I have said.”
